H0.text: Bone cells are specialized cells that can contract, sliding fibers up and down to cause heart cell contractions.

H1.text: Nerve cells are specialized cells that can contract in the heart, where fibers slide up and down to cause contractions.

H2.text: Muscle cells are the specialized heart cells that can contract by sliding fibers up and down, which causes the heart to contract.

H3.text: White blood cells are specialized cells that can contract in heart cells that have fibers that slide up and down to cause contractions.

A4.text: Specialised modified cardiomyocytes known as pacemaker cells, set the rhythm of the heart contractions.

A5.text: During contraction of a cardiac muscle cell, the long protein myofilaments oriented along the length of the cell slide over each other in what is known as the sliding filament theory.
